citation.article-title: Polyphasic classification of the genus Photorhabdus and proposal of new taxa: P. luminescens subsp. luminescens subsp. nov., P. luminescens subsp. akhurstii subsp. nov., P. luminescens subsp. laumondii subsp. nov., P. temperata sp. nov., P. temperata subsp. temperata subsp. nov. and P. asymbiotica sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Photorhabdus luminescens subsp. akhurstii subsp. nov.
Photorhabdus luminescens subsp. akhurstii (ak.hurs'tii M.L. gen. n. akhurstii of Akhurst, referring to R. Akhurst, a major contributor to the bacteriological symbionts of entomopathogenic nematodes)
Maximum temperature for growth in nutrient broth is 38-39Â°C.
Negative for tryptophan deaminase and DNase.
Annular haemolysis observed on sheep-blood agar and, in some strains, on horse-blood agar.
Utilization of DL-lactate as sole source of carbon variable; weak when positive.
Symbiotically associated with the nematode H. indica isolated in warm regions, the first strain (D1) was isolated from Australia (Darwin, Northern Territory) by R.
The type strain, FRG04T, is held in the Collection of the Institut Pasteur under accession number CIP 105564T.
The EMBL accession number of the 16s rRNA gene sequence of the type strain is AJ007359.
